text: Benjamin Wright Raymond (June 15, 1801 - April 6, 1883) was an American politician who twice served as mayor of Chicago, Illinois (1839–1840, 1842–1843) for the Whig Party. Raymond was born on June 15, 1801 in Rome, New York. He studied at St. Lawrence Academy. Raymond was married to Amelia Porter from 1835 until his death in 1883. They had a son, George Lansing. Raymond died on April 6, 1883 in Chicago, Illinois from an illness, aged 81. ==References== ==Other websites== * * 1842 Inaugural Address Category:1801 births Category:1883 deaths Category:19th-century American politicians Category:Whig Party (United States) politicians Category:Mayors of Chicago Category:Politicians from New York (state) Category:People from Rome, New York Category:Burials at Graceland Cemetery
